intro: Memora pinnatifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf memora, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, pinnately compound leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in summer. Memora pinnatifolia typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
